trial_identification.studytitle: Comparison between two clomiphene citrate protocols for induction of ovulation in clomiphene resistant Polycystic ovarian disease.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Comparison between two clomiphene citrate protocols for induction of ovulation in clomiphene resistant Polycystic ovarian disease.

interventions.interventions: clomiphene citrate oral tablets 100 mg daily for 10 days, starting within 5 days of induced menses.
interventions.comparator: control group clomiphene citrate oral tablets 200 mg daily for 5 days, starting within 5 days of induced menses.

primaryOutcome.outcome: ovulation detected by transvaginal follicle scanning, and serum progesterone value.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: chemical pregnancy by serum HCG assay.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: married, nulligravida, polycystic ovarian disease, resistant to clomiphene citrate drug in previous cycle/s
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: previous pelvic surgery, other causes of infertility, BMI>35

trial_design.sequence: Randomization using computer generated tables, results kept in sealed envelopes till the time of starting treatment.

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: 649 Elhorreya street, Janaclis, Elraml District, Alexandria Egypt. post code 03312

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The primary purpose of the study is to test if either doubling the dose of clomiphene citrate or doubling the duration would make previously unresponsive patients respond and ovulate, and to compare the efficacy of either approach.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: The ethics committee of Alexandria faculty of medicine, Alexandria university.
ethicscommitee.ethicaddress: Alexandria faculty of Medicine, Elraml district, Alexandria, Egypt. post code 03312
